description: Borrowed from French confit, past participle of confire (“to preserve”), from Latin cōnficiō (perfect passive participle cōnfectus). Doublet of comfit and konfyt.

entries.meaning: Any of various kinds of food that have been immersed in a substance for both flavor and preservation.

verbs.description: confit (third-person singular simple present confits, present participle confiting, simple past and past participle confited)
